intro: Hieracium acromaurum, commonly known as the purple sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Europe and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a distinctive yellow center. Hieracium acromaurum typically thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
